00057 void process_census(char* line)
00058 {
00059         char* name = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char));
00060         char* value = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char));
00061         sscanf(line, "%s %s\n", name, value);
00062         server_set ("census",name,value);
00063 }

00075 int handle_command(int sock, char *cmd)
00076 {
00077     struct timeval start_time, end_time;
00078     double diff_time;
00079     char buf[100];
00080     sprintf(buf, "Processing command '%s'\n", cmd);
00081     logger(buf, LOGGING, 1); 
00082         int status;
00083         char cmdnum[50];
00084         sscanf(cmd, "%s", cmdnum);
00085         if(strcmp(cmdnum, "AUTH")==0)
00086         {
00087                 char username [50];
00088                 char password [50];
00089                 sscanf(cmd, "%s %s %s", cmdnum, username, password);
00090 
00091                 //get start time
00092                 gettimeofday(&start_time, NULL);
00093 
00094                 if((strcmp(username, params.username)==0)&&(strcmp(password, params.password)==0))
00095                 {
00096                         char smessage[50];
00097                         sprintf(smessage, "S");
00098                         sendall(sock, smessage, strlen(cmd));
00099                         sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00100                 }
00101                 else
00102                 {
00103                         char emessage[50];
00104                         sprintf(emessage, "E AUTH");
00105                         sendall(sock, emessage, strlen(cmd));
00106                         sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00107                 }
00108 
00109                 //get end time and calculate difference and add to total processing time
00110                 gettimeofday(&end_time, NULL);
00111                 diff_time = end_time.tv_usec-start_time.tv_usec;
00112                 diff_time = diff_time/1000000;
00113                 totprotime += diff_time;
00114                 LOG(("Single command processing time: %.10F seconds\nTotal processing time: %.10F seconds\n", diff_time, totprotime));
00115         
00116         }
00117         else if(strcmp(cmdnum, "SET")==0)
00118         {
00119                 char table [50];
00120                 char key [50];
00121                 char record [50];
00122                 
00123                 sscanf(cmd, "%s %s %s %s", cmdnum, table, key, record);
00124                 //printf("%s %s %s %s\n", cmdnum, table, key, record);
00125                 
00126                 if(record==NULL)
00127                 {
00128                         //get start time
00129                         gettimeofday(&start_time, NULL);
00130 
00131                         status = DB_delete(db, table, key);
00132         
00133                         //get end time and calculate difference and add to total processing time
00134                         gettimeofday(&end_time, NULL);
00135                         diff_time = end_time.tv_usec-start_time.tv_usec;
00136                         diff_time = diff_time/1000000;
00137                         totprotime += diff_time;
00138                         LOG(("Single command processing time: %.10F seconds\nTotal processing time: %.10F seconds\n", diff_time, totprotime));
00139                 }
00140                 else{
00141                         //get start time
00142                         gettimeofday(&start_time, NULL);
00143 
00144                         status = DB_set(db, table, key, record);
00145 
00146                         //get end time and calculate difference and add to total processing time
00147                         gettimeofday(&end_time, NULL);
00148                         diff_time = end_time.tv_usec-start_time.tv_usec;
00149                         diff_time = diff_time/1000000;
00150                         totprotime += diff_time;
00151                         LOG(("Single command processing time: %.10F seconds\nTotal processing time: %.10F seconds\n", diff_time, totprotime));
00152                 }
00153 
00154                 if(status==-1)
00155                 {       
00156                         char emessage[50];
00157                         sprintf(emessage, "E TABLE");
00158                         sendall(sock, emessage, strlen(cmd));
00159                         sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00160                 }
00161                 else
00162                 {       
00163                         char smessage[50];
00164                         sprintf(smessage, "S");
00165                         sendall(sock, smessage, strlen(cmd));
00166                         sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00167                 }
00168         }
00169         else if(strcmp(cmdnum, "GET")==0)
00170         {
00171                 char table [50];
00172                 char key [50];
00173                 sscanf(cmd, "%s %s %s", cmdnum, table, key);
00174                 //printf("%s %s %s\n", cmdnum, table, key);
00175                 char returnval[50];
00176 
00177                 //get start time
00178                 gettimeofday(&start_time, NULL);
00179 
00180                 status = DB_get(db, table, key, returnval);
00181 
00182                 //get end time and calculate difference and add to total processing time
00183                 gettimeofday(&end_time, NULL);
00184                 diff_time = end_time.tv_usec-start_time.tv_usec;
00185                 diff_time = diff_time/1000000;
00186                 totprotime += diff_time;
00187                 LOG(("Single command processing time: %.10F seconds\nTotal processing time: %.10F seconds\n", diff_time, totprotime));
00188 
00189                 if(status==-1)
00190                 {       
00191                         char emessage[50];
00192                         sprintf(emessage, "E TABLE");
00193                         sendall(sock, emessage, strlen(cmd));
00194                         sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00195                 }
00196                 else if(status==-2)
00197                 {       
00198                         char emessage[50];
00199                         sprintf(emessage, "E KEY");
00200                         sendall(sock, emessage, strlen(cmd));                                           
00201                         sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00202                 }
00203                 else
00204                 {       
00205                         char smessage[50];
00206                         sprintf(smessage, "S %s", returnval);
00207                         sendall(sock, smessage, strlen(cmd));
00208                         sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00209                 }
00210         }
00211         else
00212         {
00213                 char emessage[50];
00214                 sprintf(emessage, "E PARAM");
00215                 sendall(sock, emessage, strlen(cmd));
00216                 sendall(sock, "\n", 1);
00217         }
00218         return 0;
00219 }

00228 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00229 {
00230 
00231     // If file logging is enabled, create the appropriate server logging file
00232     if(LOGGING == 2) {
00233         char fname[255];
00234         time_t ti;
00235         struct tm * t;
00236         time ( &ti );
00237         t = localtime ( &ti );
00238         sprintf(fname, "Server-%d-%d-%d-%d-%d-%d.log", t->tm_year+1900, t->tm_mon+1, t->tm_mday, t->tm_hour, t->tm_min, t->tm_sec);
00239         sfp = fopen(fname, "w");
00240     }
00241 
00242         db= DB_init();
00243         // Process command line arguments.
00244         // This program expects exactly one argument: the config file name.
00245         assert(argc > 0);
00246         if (argc != 2) {
00247                 printf("Usage %s <config_file>\n", argv[0]);
00248                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00249         }
00250         char *config_file = argv[1];
00251 
00252         // Read the config file.
00253 
00254         int status = read_config(config_file, &params);
00255         if (status != 0) {
00256                 printf("Error processing config file.\n");
00257                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00258         }
00259 
00260     // Log info to the logger function
00261     char buf[100];
00262     sprintf(buf, "Server on %s:%d\n", params.server_host, params.server_port);
00263     logger(buf, LOGGING, 1);
00264 
00265         // Create a socket.
00266         int listensock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00267         if (listensock < 0) {
00268                 printf("Error creating socket.\n");
00269                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00270         }
00271 
00272         // Allow listening port to be reused if defunct.
00273         int yes = 1;
00274         status = setsockopt(listensock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof yes);
00275         if (status != 0) {
00276                 printf("Error configuring socket.\n");
00277                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00278         }
00279 
00280         // Bind it to the listening port.
00281         struct sockaddr_in listenaddr;
00282         memset(&listenaddr, 0, sizeof listenaddr);
00283         listenaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00284         listenaddr.sin_port = htons(params.server_port);
00285         inet_pton(AF_INET, params.server_host, &(listenaddr.sin_addr)); // bind to local IP address
00286         status = bind(listensock, (struct sockaddr*) &listenaddr, sizeof listenaddr);
00287         if (status != 0) {
00288                 printf("Error binding socket.\n");
00289                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00290         }
00291 
00292         // Listen for connections.
00293         status = listen(listensock, MAX_LISTENQUEUELEN);
00294         if (status != 0) {
00295                 printf("Error listening on socket.\n");
00296                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00297         }
00298 
00299         // Listen loop.
00300         int wait_for_connections = 1;
00301         while (wait_for_connections) {
00302                 // Wait for a connection.
00303                 struct sockaddr_in clientaddr;
00304                 socklen_t clientaddrlen = sizeof clientaddr;
00305                 int clientsock = accept(listensock, (struct sockaddr*)&clientaddr, &clientaddrlen);
00306                 if (clientsock < 0) {
00307                         printf("Error accepting a connection.\n");
00308                         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00309                 }
00310 
00311         char buf[100];
00312         sprintf(buf, "Got a connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port);
00313         logger(buf, LOGGING, 1); 
00314         
00315         //      store raw data into database, start up
00316         FILE *file = fopen("census.conf", "r");
00317         DB_addTable(db, "census");
00318 
00319         while(file!=NULL && !feof(file))
00320         {
00321                 char line[40];
00322                 char *l = fgets(line, sizeof line, file);
00323                 if (l == line)
00324                         process_census(line);
00325         }
00326 // initialize table in config file
00327         int i = 0;
00328         while(params.table[i]!=NULL)
00329         {
00330                 LOG(("setting table %s", params.table[i]));
00331                 DB_addTable(db,params.table[i]);
00332                 i++;
00333         }
00334 
00335                 // Get commands from client.
00336                 int wait_for_commands = 1;
00337                 do {
00338                         // Read a line from the client.
00339                         char cmd[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00340                         int status = recvline(clientsock, cmd, MAX_CMD_LEN);
00341                         if (status != 0) {
00342                                 // Either an error occurred or the client closed the connection.
00343                                 wait_for_commands = 0;
00344                         } else {
00345                                 // Handle the command from the client.
00346                                 int status = handle_command(clientsock, cmd);
00347                                 if (status != 0)
00348                                         wait_for_commands = 0; // Oops.  An error occured.
00349                         }
00350                 } while (wait_for_commands);
00351                 
00352                 // Close the connection with the client.
00353                 close(clientsock);
00354                 
00355         sprintf(buf, "Closed connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port);
00356         logger(buf, LOGGING, 1);
00357         }
00358 
00359         // Stop listening for connections.
00360         close(listensock);
00361 
00362         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00363 }
